semantic_title: Hurricane Aftermath - Other External Causes of Morbidity Code Issues and Indirect Injuries
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 19. Coding for Healthcare Encounters in Hurricane Aftermath > c. Other External Causes of Morbidity Code Issues

content.full_text: For injuries that are not a direct result of the hurricane, such as an evacuee that has incurred an injury as a result of a motor vehicle accident, assign the appropriate external cause of morbidity code(s) to describe the cause of the injury, but do not assign code X37.0-, Hurricane. If it is not clear whether the injury was a direct result of the hurricane, assume the injury is due to the hurricane and assign code X37.0-, Hurricane, as well as any other applicable external cause of morbidity codes. In addition to code X37.0-, Hurricane, other possible applicable external cause of morbidity codes include: X30-, Exposure to excessive natural heat; X31-, Exposure to excessive natural cold; X38-, Flood. (Evidence: pg no: 18, L84-L90)
content.summary: Provides guidance for distinguishing direct vs. indirect hurricane-related injuries and lists additional applicable external cause codes for hurricane aftermath encounters (Evidence: pg no: 18, L84-L90)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For injuries that are not a direct result of the hurricane, do not assign code X37.0-, Hurricane (Evidence: pg no: 18, L84-L85)
detailed_rules.explanation: When injuries occur to hurricane victims but are not directly caused by the hurricane (such as motor vehicle accidents during evacuation), the hurricane code should not be used (Evidence: pg no: 18, L84-L85)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If it is not clear whether the injury was a direct result of the hurricane, assume the injury is due to the hurricane (Evidence: pg no: 18, L85-L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation is unclear about whether an injury is directly hurricane-related, coders should assume it is hurricane-related and assign the hurricane code along with other applicable external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 18, L85-L86)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Additional external cause codes may be applicable in addition to hurricane code (Evidence: pg no: 18, L86-L90)
detailed_rules.explanation: Various other external cause codes may be relevant for hurricane-related injuries, including exposure to heat, cold, and flooding (Evidence: pg no: 18, L86-L90)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if injury is directly hurricane-related
Step 2: If clearly not direct, use appropriate non-hurricane external cause codes
Step 3: If unclear, assume hurricane-related and use X37.0-
Step 4: Consider additional applicable external cause codes
Step 5: Assign multiple codes as appropriate for complete description
